{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks which zone is characterized by macrophages and osteoclasts. We can analyze the given documents to find the answer. In the first document, it is mentioned that macrophages disrupt calcified tissue extracellularly and appear to engulf large fragments of mineralized matrix. Ruffled borders, which are common features of osteoclasts at sites of resorption of bone, do not develop in macrophages. Clear zones are seen in both macrophages and osteoclasts. This suggests that macrophages and osteoclasts share a similar zone or region.", "answer_choice": "A"}
